change.description: Siluq is missing from last word in verse, add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun segol he sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun segol he sof-pasuq

notes.note: Every verse should end with a siluq accent. No siluq is present in this word (a meteg occurs on the initial he).
The most likely position for a siluq on this word is under the nun.

change.description: Change zaqef-qatan over ayin to revia, add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva mem qubuts ayin qamats zaqef-qatan he
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva mem qubuts ayin qamats revia he

notes.note: A single dot appears above the ayin with no sign of a second dot above it. The zaqef-qatan will be replaced by a revia to represent the single dot.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a revia over the ayin; BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Add meteg to ayin.
change.refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
change.changeuni: ayin patah meteg lamed maqaf

notes.note: The maqaf is well-formed and well positioned, but lighter than the surrounding characters. The change produces the chanted word עַֽל־אֲשֶׁר־הֵמִ֖ית.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a meteg under the ayin; BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove maqaf from word, add note 'm'.
change.refuni: mem holam meteg qof sheva shin shin-dot tsere yod maqaf
change.changeuni: mem holam meteg qof sheva shin shin-dot tsere yod

notes.note: No maqaf between this word and the next is evident and the meteg, as a secondary accent, is missing a primary accent.
The meteg should probably be a taken as a merkha; however, it lacks the necessary northeast-to-southwest inclination.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has a merkha on the mem and no maqaf on this word. BHL Appendix A does not comment on this word.

change.description: Add maqaf to end of word.

change.description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
change.refuni: dalet dagesh qamats bet qamats resh pashta
change.changeuni: dalet qamats bet qamats resh pashta

notes.note: The rafeh above the dalet (indicating no dagesh) is clear.
Ben Denckla: BHL agrees that there is no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
This case is similar, but not identical, to that of Jer 32:6.4 (2022.08.14 - 11).

The Hebrew Wikisource Miqra According to the Masorah (23 Sep 2022) has a qadma on the yod.

change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh sheva shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem sheva ayin vav dagesh pashta

change.changeuni: het hataf-patah lamed dagesh qubuts qof tsere meteg yod maqaf

Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001) notes this as a particularity of the LC.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a patah under the het; BHL Appendix A finds a hataf-patah under the het in the LC.

change.description: Remove sof-pasuq. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: ayin segol qof sheva resh meteg vav holam final-nun sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: ayin segol qof sheva resh meteg vav holam final-nun

notes.note: This verse lacks an ending sof-pasuq.
Ben Denckla: BHL ends the word with a sof-pasuq; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

change.description: Unclear accent under the ayin. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav
change.changeuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav

notes.note: The text quality in the region around this word is good. The tsere under the ayin is clear; the three dots to the left of the tsere are confusing. None of the these dots can be associated with the lamed on the next line. Identify the 3 dots as North, South, and West. North is lighter and blurry; but has a slight vertical component. The space between North and South appears empty. The West dot might be ignored with North and South joined to make a near-vertical meteg/merkha. Alternatively, a tevir could be formed from all three dots again by joining North and South; unfortunately, this gives the odd arrangement of two successive tevirs in the verse.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the ayin; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

change.description: Change hataf-patah under aleph to patah.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah he tsere bet patah meteg tav sheva he vav dagesh sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: alef patah he tsere bet patah meteg tav sheva he vav dagesh sof-pasuq

notes.note: Ben Denckla: BHL has a hataf-patah under the aleph; BHL Appendix A finds a patah under the ayin in the LC but notes the difficulty reading the LC.

change.description: Consider final yod instead of vav.
change.refuni: bet resh bet bet tav vav
change.changeuni: bet resh bet bet tav vav

notes.note: The word in question is the ketiv part of a ketiv/qere pair. In the LC the body text contains the ketiv consonants with the qere vowel and accent markings. The consonants for the qere are written in the margin.

The existing ketiv body text has a vav as the final character; a "his ten thousand" ending. The referent for the "his" is David in word 20. The change author suggests that the final letter might instead be a yod; a "my ten thousand" ending. No referent for "my" is apparent in the verse.

The qere consonants in the margin clearly end in yod then vav; a grammatical "his ten thousands" ending shown in the following qere word 21, so that proposed difference between the ketiv/qere forms is "my ten thousand" and "his ten thousands". That is, the proposal changes the person from "my" to "his" while changing the number "ten thousand" to "ten thousands". This in contrast to preceding ketiv/qere pair in words 18 and 19 which has a ketiv meaning "his thousand" and a qere reading "his thousands". That is, in words 18, 19, the ketiv/qere forms are thousand/thousands and both have third person singular endings referring to Saul, word 17. The parallelism common in the Hebrew text (words 17, 18, 19 parallel to words 20, 21, 22) would suggest that the following ketiv/qere pair in words 21, 22 would be "his ten thousand"/"his ten thousands".
Placing a yod as the final ketiv constant in word 21 adds an unknown referent (who is "my"?) and breaks an obviously intended parallelism with words 18, 19.

Ben Denckla: The distinguished Israeli biblical scholar Mordecai Breuer (1921-2007) as well as the change author, Daniel Holman, noted that the final letter is somewhat ambiguous and might be construed as yod. BHL ends the word with a vav; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

notes.note: Hataf vowels are composed of a sheva-then-vowel sequence. They are never written vowel-then-sheva. The sheva belongs to a hataf-patah on the he; however, it is positioned very early under the lamed because of the top of a lamed on the following verse.

The Sefaria MAM has no consonant between the resh and the kaf.

Ben Denckla: BHL agrees with the UXLC word. The BHL Appendix A agrees with the change author that an erasure may have taken place and suggests that the original contents of the manuscript was a malei spelling of the word, בְּרוּכִ֤ים. While this is an interesting speculation, this is irrelevant to UXLC's main text since it tries to transcribe the final state of the manuscript.

change.description: Split the word by adding a maqaf between the he and the aleph.
change.refuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere darga lamed
change.changeuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere darga lamed

notes.note: The LC has a distinct maqaf between the he and the aleph. The maqaf has equal darkness to the that on the preceding word. The LC has a maqaf in 5 of 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) never has a maqaf in the 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.

change.description: Change qamats under gimel to patah.
change.refuni: he qubuts gimel dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan shin shin-dot vav dagesh
change.changeuni: he qubuts gimel dagesh patah zaqef-qatan shin shin-dot vav dagesh

notes.note: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a qamats under the gimel.

change.description: Change segol under aleph to tsere. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: he patah bet dagesh sheva alef segol meteg resh holam tav hiriq tipeha yod
change.changeuni: he patah bet dagesh sheva alef tsere meteg resh holam tav hiriq tipeha yod

notes.note: The two horizontal dots under the aleph have a much fainter dot below them that would make the vowel a segol.
Ben Denckla: BHL has tsere under the aleph. BHL Appendix A has segol with a question mark.

change.description: Possible merkha instead of meteg under the yod. Add note 'm'.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg lamed sheva kaf tevir vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg lamed sheva kaf tevir vav dagesh

notes.note: The vertical line under the yod lacks the required northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the yod.

change.description: Move etnahta from under bet to under kaf.
change.refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats bet etnahta vav holam
change.changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats etnahta bet vav holam

notes.note: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has an etnahta under the bet.

change.description: Remove dageshes from yod and dalet. Add rafe to dalet.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq vav dagesh qamats merkha lamed sheva dalet dagesh vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq vav dagesh qamats merkha lamed sheva dalet rafe vav dagesh

notes.note: The BHL has a dagesh in the yod and no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Partially erased text starts after this word. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: het hataf-patah dalet qamats shin shin-dot qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: het hataf-patah dalet qamats shin shin-dot qamats meteg he sof-pasuq

notes.note: This note and the note on the following verse delimit an anomaly in the LC caused by scribal error. The error has been partially erased in the LC, but enough remains to understand what may have happened. The error has no effect on the transcription because the surrounding verses are legibly written.

The text following this word at column 1, line 25, of Folio_171B is partially erased in the LC. The erasure leaves only the top part of the text at the bottom of column 1 (as shown in the image) and at the top of column 2. Then 2 Samuel 6:4 appears legibly at column 2, line 3 of Folio_171B.

Careful examination by Ben Denckla of the erasure suggests that the erased consonantal text is a repetition of consonants of 2 Samuel 6:3.8-20. This consonantal text was then pointed with the points from 6:4.1-5. This can be seen by the revia on the "‬‏וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֗הוּ" in the erasure. The accents in the erasure stop after the 5-th word as the accent writer realized that the 6-th word didn't belong to 6:4.

The hypothesis is that the consonant writer repeated 6:3.8-20 thinking he was writing 6:4. When he realized his mistake, he then wrote the consonants for 6:4 and the remainder of the page. The accent writer applied 6:4 accents to the accidental repetition of 6:3.8-20, stopping when he reached the 6-th word which was incorrect for verse 6:4. A decision was then made to partially erase the repetition.

change.description: Partially erased text ends with this word. Add note 't'
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats alef qubuts revia he vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats alef qubuts revia he vav dagesh

notes.note: This note and the note on the previous verse delimit an anomaly in the LC caused by scribal error. The error has been partially erased in the LC, but enough remains to understand what may have happened. The error has no effect on the transcription because the surrounding verses are legibly written.

The text preceding this word at column 2, line 3, of Folio_171B is partially erased in the LC. The erasure leaves only the top part of the text at the bottom of column 1 (as shown in the image) and at the top of column 2. Then 2 Samuel 6:4 appears legibly at column 2, line 3 of Folio_171B.

Careful examination by Ben Denckla of the erasure suggests that the erased consonantal text is a repetition of consonants of 2 Samuel 6:3.8-20. This consonantal text was then pointed with the points from 6:4.1-5. This can be seen by the revia on the "‬‏וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֗הוּ" in the erasure. The accents in the erasure stop after the 5-th word as the accent writer realized that the 6-th word didn't belong to 6:4.

The hypothesis is that the consonant writer repeated 6:3.8-20 thinking he was writing 6:4. When he realized his mistake, he then wrote the consonants for 6:4 and the remainder of the page. The accent writer applied 6:4 accents to the accidental repetition of 6:3.8-20, stopping when he reached the 6-th word which was incorrect for verse 6:4. A decision was then made to partially erase the repetition.

change.description: Remove maqaf, merging 2 words to 1.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh maqaf space alef patah mahapakh final-pe
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh alef patah mahapakh final-pe

notes.note: UXLC word differs from the other texts. The UXLC does not split the 6 consonants between the resh and the aleph, lacks a maqaf after the resh, and has no sheva on the resh because neither is visible in the photo.

Ben Denckla: The BHL splits the 6 consonants between the resh and the aleph and adds a maqaf after the resh. It has no sheva on the resh. BHL Appendix A contains a p.m. (prima manus) note: "version by the first hand, changed subsequently (p. xxv)". It does NOT split the 6 consonants and has no maqaf. It does have a sheva on the resh, however. Perhaps the p.m. note refers only to the suggestion that the resh originally had a sheva under it.

change.description: Change qadma on nun to pashta on yod.
change.refuni: lamed sheva ayin tsere yod nun tsere qadma yod
change.changeuni: lamed sheva ayin tsere yod nun tsere yod pashta

notes.note: BHL has a pashta on yod. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change munah to meteg under the aleph.
change.refuni: alef tsere munah yod final-nun
change.changeuni: alef tsere meteg yod final-nun

notes.note: The BHL has munah under the aleph. Surprisingly, BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM agrees with this change proposal and notes that L has meteg here.

change.description: Remove maqaf, merging 2 words to 1. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: alef patah meteg het hataf-patah resh tsere yod maqaf space kaf tsere zaqef-qatan final-nun
change.changeuni: alef patah meteg het hataf-patah resh tsere yod kaf tsere zaqef-qatan final-nun

notes.note: UXLC word differs from the other texts. The UXLC does not split the 6 consonants between the resh and the yod also lacks a maqaf after the resh because no maqaf is visible in the photo.
The Sefaria MAM has a maqaf between the resh and the yod.
Ben Denckla: The BHL splits the 6 consonants between the resh and the yod and adds a maqaf after the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Add dagesh to zayin.
change.refuni: bet dagesh qamats zayin segol tevir he
change.changeuni: bet dagesh qamats zayin dagesh segol tevir he
change.notes: The dagesh on the zayin is dark and shaped like the dagesh in the bet. The BHL has no dagesh in zayin. Surprisingly, BHL Appendix A does not have an entry for this word. Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM notes that L has a dagesh in the zayin of this word.>

change.description: Move zaqef-qatan from het to dalet. Add 'c' note.
change.refuni: he patah het segol zaqef-qatan dalet segol resh
change.changeuni: he patah het segol dalet segol zaqef-qatan resh

notes.note: Ben Denckla: BHL has zaqef-qatan on ḥet. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has zaqef-qatan on dalet.

change.description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed segol final-kaf sheva
change.changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed segol final-kaf

notes.note: Ben Denckla: BHL has kaf with sheva. BHL Appendix A has kaf without sheva.

change.description: Change resh to dalet. Add note 't' on second-to-last consonant.
change.refuni: ayin mem yod het vav resh
change.changeuni: ayin mem yod het vav dalet

notes.note: The next-to-last consonant (yod or vav) is ambiguous in the ketiv in the body text, but is clearly a vav in the qere in the margin. BHL Appendix A lists both possibilities (yod or vav). Ben Denckla: The LC is unique among sources studied by Breuer that has the possibility of a yod in the second-to-last position of this word.
The final letter is clearly a dalet in both ketiv and qere forms in the LC from the image. The BHL ends the ketiv with a resh; in BHL Appendix A both possibilities end in a dalet.

Ben Denckla: BHL ends the ketiv in a resh, עמיחור (last two letters vav-resh). BHL Appendix A lists two possible readings of the L ketiv, both ending in ד (dalet) and both question-marked: Reading 1: עמיחיד (?) (yod-dalet), Reading 2: עמיחוד (?) (vav-dalet).

change.description: Add yod between mem and tav.
change.refuni: vav dagesh nun sheva mem hiriq tav tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta
change.changeuni: vav dagesh nun sheva mem hiriq yod tav tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta

notes.note: The yod is well-formed, with the lower portion lighter probably due to flaking.

Ben Denckla: BHL has no yod (a חסר (ḥaser) (deficient) spelling). BHL Appendix A suggests the possibility of a yod (a מלא (malei) (full) spelling). That is, it lists the word spelled with a yod, but adds a question mark in parenthesis.

change.description: Consider moving the patah on the dalet to create a hataf-patah under the mem.
change.refuni: he patah meteg mem sheva dalet patah bet dagesh tsere mahapakh resh
change.changeuni: he patah meteg mem sheva dalet patah bet dagesh tsere mahapakh resh

notes.note: The top of the lamed of the following line interferes with the positioning of the patah. The space between the patah and the sheva is greater than expected for a hataf-patah.
The BHL agrees with the reference UXLC word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads the LC and other manuscripts including Aleppo Codex as having ḥataf-pataḥ on mem here.

change.description: Consider adding note 't' for possible patah rather than hiriq under the mem.
change.refuni: mem hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah resh patah merkha tav
change.changeuni: mem hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah resh patah merkha tav

notes.note: The dot of the hireq is significantly darker than the continuation which would make a patah.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a hiriq under the mem.

change.description: Change merkha to tevir under bet.
change.refuni: yod qamats bet merkha vav holam alef
change.changeuni: yod qamats bet tevir vav holam alef

notes.note: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tevir under the bet.

change.description: Change merkha under shin to tipeha.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol merkha resh
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol tipeha resh

notes.note: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the shin.

change.description: Change tipeha under tet to meteg. Add note 'm'.
change.refuni: tet tipeha vav holam bet
change.changeuni: tet meteg vav holam bet

notes.note: The vertical line under the tet lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tipeha under the tet.

change.description: Consider dagesh in nun for possible 't' note.
change.refuni: nun dagesh qamats revia alef
change.changeuni: nun dagesh qamats revia alef

notes.note: The text is in good condition near this word. The dot in the nun is well-positioned, but light.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the nun.

change.description: Add zaqef-qatan above shin. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam ayin tsere zaqef-qatan resh
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam ayin tsere zaqef-qatan resh

notes.note: The shin has a dark and well-positioned zaqef-qatan over it. This accent is unexpected here.
The BHL has no zaqef-qatan on the shin. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM appears to support the zaqef-qatan over the shin.

change.description: Consider a possible accent segol above the aleph. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot qamats alef zaqef-qatan vav dagesh lamed
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats alef zaqef-qatan vav dagesh lamed

notes.note: The two dark dots above the aleph are significantly inclined from the vertical and the third, lighter, dot forms a putative segol. However, the writer of this page has a tendency to incline the dots of the zaqef-qatan as done in at least three other instances on this page.
The BHL has a zaqef-qatan on the aleph. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol etnahta lamed segol final-kaf sheva
change.changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol etnahta lamed segol final-kaf

notes.note: This is the first instance of three instances of the poetic word ending in ־הַמֶּלֶך in this verse. It's the only one without a sheva.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a sheva in the final kaf. BHL Appendix A agrees with this UXLC change proposal: it has a final kaf lacking a sheva.

change.description: Consider possible tevir rather than merkha under the nun.
change.refuni: he hiriq nun dagesh tsere merkha he
change.changeuni: he hiriq nun dagesh tsere merkha he

notes.note: The dot of the putative tevir is of a different color than other dots and slightly larger.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

change.description: Remove dagesh from yod.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats het hataf-patah mem merkha vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed dagesh qamats het hataf-patah mem merkha vav dagesh

notes.note: Although other dots in this region of text are light, no dagesh is in the yod.
Ben Denckla: BHL has this yod with a dagesh. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has this yod without a dagesh.

change.description: Replace tipeha under nun with merkha.
change.refuni: vav sheva ayin tsere yod nun segol tipeha yod final-kaf qamats
change.changeuni: vav sheva ayin tsere yod nun segol merkha yod final-kaf qamats

notes.note: The vertical line under the nun has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

change.description: Replace merkha under first mem with tipeha.
change.refuni: resh qamats mem hiriq merkha yod final-mem
change.changeuni: resh qamats mem hiriq tipeha yod final-mem

notes.note: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tipeha under the first mem.

change.description: Remove hiriq from under kaf. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq yod telisha-qetana
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh yod telisha-qetana

notes.note: The word lacks a vowel, hence the 'c' note. The dot far below the kaf is from a holam on the following line.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a ḥiriq on this kaf. BHL Appendix A agrees that in L, this kaf lacks any vowel marking, and thus lacks the expected ḥiriq.

change.description: Change patah under ayin to hataf-patah. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he qamats meteg ayin patah nun dagesh sheva tav holam tav hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
change.changeuni: he qamats meteg ayin hataf-patah nun dagesh sheva tav holam tav hiriq zaqef-qatan yod

notes.note: The sheva-like part of the hataf-patah is widely separated from the patah part.
Ben Denckla: BHL has this ayin with a normal (full) pataḥ under the ayin. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has this ayin with a ḥataf pataḥ.

change.description: Remove hiriq from lamed. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: yod sheva resh meteg vav dagesh shin shin-dot qamats lamed patah hiriq final-mem zinor
change.changeuni: yod sheva resh meteg vav dagesh shin shin-dot qamats lamed patah final-mem zinor

notes.note: Jerusalem normally has a hiriq as well as a patah on the lamed.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a pataḥ and then a ḥiriq on this lamed. BHL Appendix A agrees that in L, this lamed has only a pataḥ, i.e. this lamed lacks the expected ḥiriq.

change.description: Add dagesh to bet, add paseq at end of word.
change.refuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet hiriq qadma yod alef
change.changeuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet dagesh hiriq qadma yod alef space paseq

notes.note: The dagesh in the bet is reddish and larger than others. It is better than the dagesh in the nun. The paseq is the vertical line touching the knee of the following lamed.
The BHL has no dagesh in the bet and the word is followed by a paseq. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the bet; the paseq is not shown in the Appendix.
Ben Denckla pointed out the missing paseq which was not part of the original change.

change.description: Damaged text. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: het patah gimel dagesh tsere revia yod tav
change.changeuni: het patah gimel dagesh tsere revia yod tav

notes.note: The text is damaged, particularly on the gimel and yod.
The BHL has a dagesh, hireq, and revia on the gimel. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word, word 4; it does have an entry for words 6, 7, however.

change.description: Change patah under bet to segol.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot segol pashta bet patah ayin pashta
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot segol pashta bet patah ayin pashta

notes.note: The dots under the bet are dark and form a poorly-shaped segol.
The BHL has a patah under the bet. BHL Appendix A has a segol under the bet.

change.description: Move dagesh in shin to nun.
change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun patah mem dagesh hiriq yod tav pashta
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot qubuts nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq yod tav pashta

notes.note: The BHL has a dagesh in the shin; it has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun and no dagesh in the shin.

change.description: Add dagesh to gimel.
change.refuni: bet dagesh sheva gimel hiriq bet sheva ayin revia vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: bet dagesh sheva gimelt dagesh hiriq bet sheva ayin revia vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The dagesh is well-positioned, but light and reddish.
The BHL has a no dagesh in the gimel. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change pashta to qadma to final kaf.
change.refuni: ayin patah bet sheva dalet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats pashta
change.changeuni: ayin patah bet sheva dalet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats qadma

notes.note: The BHL has a qadma on the final kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Add qadma to kaf.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh qamats lamed maqaf
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh qamats qadma lamed maqaf

notes.note: The accent could also be a pashta depending on how its horizontal position is interpreted.
The BHL has a qadma on the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM positions this mark as a qadma in its transcription of the LC.

change.description: Remove dagesh from nun.
change.refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
change.changeuni: he patah nun hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem

notes.note: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 9:23.3.
The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the nun.

change.description: Change mahapakh under resh to munah.
change.refuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
change.changeuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq munah yod final-mem

notes.note: The BHL has hiriq, munah on the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change munah under resh to mahapakh.
change.refuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq munah yod final-mem
change.changeuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem

notes.note: The BHL has a mahapakh, not a munah, on the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove maqaf.
change.refuni: alef segol tav maqaf
change.changeuni: alef segol tav

notes.note: The BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads LC as having no maqaf between את and הכרובים.

change.description: Remove dagesh from nun.
change.refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq revia yod final-mem
change.changeuni: he patah nun hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq revia yod final-mem

notes.note: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 5:30.3.
The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the nun.

change.description: Change pashta on aleph to qadma on tsadi.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem sheva tsadi qamats alef pashta
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem sheva tsadi qamats qadma alef

notes.note: Although the position of the accent on the tsadi is late, the accent must be a qadma as it has no matching final pashta.
The BHL has a qadma on the tsadi. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change segol under vav to patah. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh segol final-kaf qamats segol
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh patah final-kaf qamats segol

notes.note: The marking under the vav is poorly written, but is clearly not a segol.
The BHL has a segol, not a patah, under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM supports replacing segol with pataḥ under vav of אצוך.

change.description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol munah lamed segol final-kaf sheva
change.changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol munah lamed segol final-kaf

notes.note: This is the second "המלך" in the verse.
The BHL has a sheva on the final kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Replace tipeha and patah from under resh with qamats. Poor text condition, add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef segol pe sheva resh patah tipeha yod hiriq final-mem
change.changeuni: alef segol pe sheva resh qamats yod hiriq final-mem

notes.note: The text is in poor condition; no tipeha is visible under the resh. This leaves the word without an accent. The blob in the second consonant could be mistaken for a dagesh; however, BHL and UXLC view it as part of a pe that was disconnected from the rest of the pe.
The BHL has a qamats (not a patah) and tipeha under the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM supports the replacement of the pataḥ with qamats; however, it asserts that there is a tipeḥa under the resh.

change.description: Add meteg under tav.
change.refuni: ayin qamats meteg tav dagesh qamats he sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: ayin qamats meteg tav dagesh qamats meteg he sof-pasuq

notes.note: The BHL has a meteg only on the ayin; it has no meteg on the tav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads the L as in the proposed change with an unexpected second meteg.
Above, we use meteg without distinguishing it from siluq.

change.description: Move qadma on vav to the bet.
change.refuni: vav dagesh qadma bet sheva het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
change.changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qadma het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam

notes.note: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 15:34.8.
The BHL has a qadma on the initial vav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having qadma on bet.

change.description: Remove sheva from under qof.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof sheva shin shin-dot holam qadma resh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof shin shin-dot holam qadma resh

notes.note: The slash on the upper right before of the vav is the sof-pasuq of the preceding verse.
The BHL has a sheva under the qof. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the qof.

change.description: Add dagesh to yod.
change.refuni: vav patah yod sheva mem hiriq tav tsere munah he vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh sheva mem hiriq tav tsere munah he vav dagesh

notes.note: The BHL has no dagesh on the yod. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a dagesh in the yod of וימתהו.

change.description: Move qadma above initial vav to following bet.
change.refuni: vav dagesh qadma bet sheva het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
change.changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qadma het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam

notes.note: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 15:26.8.
On the initial vav, BHL has a qadma in addition to the central dot (Unicode: dagesh) that makes the vav a shuruq. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having qadma on bet.

change.description: Change hataf-segol below the aleph to a hataf-patah. Remove munah below he. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he tsere munah yod
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah lamed holam he tsere yod

notes.note: This section of text is of poor quality. No segol-like accent appears below the aleph. No munah is apparent below the he.
The BHL has a hataf-segol on the aleph and a tsere followed by munah on the he. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove qadma above the kaf. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh holam qadma lamed
change.changeuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh holam lamed

notes.note: This section of text is of poor quality. Two words are shown in the image; the first word is word 13, the subject of this change. The dagesh and the holam on the kaf are very faint. Comparing the lameds in both words shows no evidence of an accent on the final lamed of word 13.
The BHL has a holam and a dagesh on the kaf. It also has a pashta on the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Replace munah under lamed with meteg. Add maqaf to end of word. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: lamed hiriq munah yod
change.changeuni: lamed hiriq meteg yod maqaf

notes.note: This section of text is of poor quality. Note the verse has two words of lamed followed by yod; this word is the first lamed followed by yod. No munah is apparent on the lamed, the hiriq and meteg are very faint.
The BHL has a hiriq followed by munah under the lamed. It has no maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word; it does have an entry for word 16 in this verse, however.

change.description: Change munah under the bet to a mahapakh.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq dalet sheva bet patah munah resh
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq dalet sheva bet patah mahapakh resh

notes.note: The BHL has a patah then munah under the bet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a mahapakh under the bet.

change.description: Remove tipeha under aleph. Add note 't'
change.refuni: resh sheva alef hiriq tipeha yod
change.changeuni: resh sheva alef hiriq yod

notes.note: The text quality is very poor here. The top, left side of the lamed on the following line might be taken as an accent on the aleph or yod. No tipeha under the aleph is apparent.
The BHL has a sheva under the resh and a hiriq and tipeha under the aleph. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Replace merkha under het with tipeha.
change.refuni: het patah merkha yod
change.changeuni: het patah tipeha yod

notes.note: The BHL has a patah and merkha under the het. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Replace hataf-patah under ayin with patah.
change.refuni: bet dagesh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin hataf-patah zayin qamats bet sheva kaf segol final-mem pashta
change.changeuni: bet dagesh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin patah zayin qamats bet sheva kaf segol final-mem pashta

notes.note: The BHL has a hataf-patah under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has a patah under the ayin.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a pataḥ under the ayin.

change.description: Remove dagesh on nun.
change.refuni: qof hiriq nun dagesh tsere geresh alef tav hiriq yod
change.changeuni: qof hiriq nun tsere geresh alef tav hiriq yod

notes.note: The BHL has a dagesh, tsere, and geresh on the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having no dagesh in the nun.

change.description: Remove dagesh from yod.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem
change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem

notes.note: The BHL has a hiriq and a dagesh on the yod. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the yod.

change.description: Move mahapakh under gimel to dalet.
change.refuni: he patah gimel dagesh qamats mahapakh dalet vav holam lamed
change.changeuni: he patah gimel dagesh qamats dalet mahapakh vav holam lamed

notes.note: The BHL has a mahapakh under the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change merkha under nun to meteg. Add maqaf to end of word.
change.refuni: nun holam merkha kaf patah het
change.changeuni: nun holam meteg kaf patah het maqaf

notes.note: The vertical line under the nun has a insufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha. The BHL has a meteg under the nun; thus no 'm' note has been added.
The BHL has a meteg under the nun and a maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having meteg-maqaf (נֹֽכַח־) on this word.

change.description: Remove holam from lamed, add meteg to lamed.
change.refuni: lamed holam alef maqaf
change.changeuni: lamed meteg alef maqaf

notes.note: The BHL has a holam on the lamed and a meteg under lamed. BHL Appendix A has a meteg but no holam on the lamed.

change.description: Move tevir from tav to yod.
change.refuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed hiriq yod dagesh qamats tav tevir vav holam
change.changeuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed hiriq yod dagesh qamats tevir tav vav holam

notes.note: The sheva mark under the bet must belong to the patah under the ayin in the usual form of hataf-patah.
The BHL has a tevir on the tav. BHL Appendix A has the tevir on the yod. Both BHL and BHL Appendix A have a patah under the bet and a hataf-patah under the ayin.

change.description: Change accent over kaf from zaqef-qatan to revia.
change.refuni: mem patah lamed sheva alef qamats kaf hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
change.changeuni: mem patah lamed sheva alef qamats kaf hiriq revia yod final-mem

notes.note: The BHL has a revia on the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word, but has an entry for word 5.

change.description: Remove dagesh from nun.
change.refuni: vav qamats he tsere etnahta nun dagesh qamats he
change.changeuni: vav qamats he tsere etnahta nun qamats he

notes.note: The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove dagesh from shin, add dagesh to nun.
change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh vav dagesh nun patah mem dagesh hiriq merkha yod tav
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot vav dagesh nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq merkha yod tav

notes.note: The BHL has a dagesh in the shin and no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Add dagesh to nun.
change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun patah mem dagesh hiriq munah yod tav
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq munah yod tav

notes.note: The BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun. Both BHL and BHL Appendix A have a dagesh in the shin.

change.description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
change.refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh segol lamed dagesh qamats tipeha nun vav dagesh
change.changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh segol lamed qamats tipeha nun vav dagesh

notes.note: The BHL has dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the lamed.

change.description: Change sheva under resh to patah.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah revia resh sheva alef
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah revia resh patah alef

notes.note: The BHL has sheva on the resh. BHL Appendix A has a patah on the resh.

change.description: Consider first letter as possible bet.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf

notes.note: The bump on the leading edge of the putative bet is higher than expected and is slightly off-color with the bet itself.
The BHL has kaf as the initial consonant. BHL Appendix A has a bet as the initial letter and a question mark (?).

change.description: Change hataf-patah under het to sheva.
change.refuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats he alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed
change.changeuni: het sheva zayin qamats he alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed

notes.note: The BHL has a hataf-patah under the het. BHL Appendix A has sheva on the het.

change.description: Change merkha under nun to tipeha.
change.refuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha yod
change.changeuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere tipeha yod

notes.note: The BHL has a tipeha under the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Change tipeha under aleph to meteg. Add note 'm'.
change.refuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats alef tsere tipeha lamed
change.changeuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats alef tsere meteg lamed

notes.note: The vertical line under the aleph lacks sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The BHL has a merkha under the aleph, not a tipeha. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Replace sheva on shin with patah. Add 't' note. Replace merkha on lamed with meteg. Add 'm' note.
change.refuni: vav dagesh meteg shin shin-dot sheva lamed patah merkha het
change.changeuni: vav dagesh meteg shin shin-dot patah lamed patah meteg het

notes.note: The vowel under the shin is hard to determine. A patah is a better fit than a sheva.

A blob emerges from the top of the lamed of a word on the following line; word 22 of this verse. The blob might be considered in determining the markings on the shin of this word, word 19. There is a similar blob emerging from the lamed of the 5-th word of this verse. Consequently, the blob is considered to be an odd part of the lamed of word 22 and not part of the markings on the shin of word 19.
The BHL has a hataf patah under the shin and a merkha under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has a patah under the shin.

change.description: Replace merkha under pe with tipeha.
change.refuni: vav sheva kaf patah pe dagesh merkha vav holam tav
change.changeuni: vav sheva kaf patah pe dagesh merkha vav holam tav

notes.note: The BHL has merkha under the pe. BHL Appendix A has a tipeha under the pe.

change.description: Remove munah from under shin.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol munah resh
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh

notes.note: This word does not have a maqaf in the LC and is therefore lacking an accent.
The BHL has no accent under the shin and a final maqaf. BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word; it has an entry for word 10.

change.description: Change hataf-patah under ayin to patah. Change merkha under shin to meteg. Add note 'm'.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah meteg ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol merkha he
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah meteg ayin patah shin sin-dot segol meteg he

notes.note: The vertical line under the shin lacks sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.

change.description: Replace revia on samekh with telisha-gedola.
change.refuni: samekh qamats revia resh
change.changeuni: samekh qamats telisha-gedola resh

notes.note: Although the "tail" of the telisha isn't visible, the circle in the image is prepositive. Hence it is transcribed as a telisha-gedola.
The BHL has a telisha-gedola above the samekh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace munah under samekh with meteg. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh tsere munah pe segol resh
change.changeuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh tsere meteg pe segol resh

notes.note: The vertical line under the samekh has a slight northwest-to-southeast inclination and might be transcribed as a tipeha. A tipeha is unexpected here, however.

An erasure appears to have occurred at the lower, left corner of the line under the samekh. This erasure might have been of the horizontal line of a munah. The vertical line of a munah has a slight northwest-to-southeast inclination and if the horizontal line of a munah is erased, the result would have the shape shown in the image; a slightly inclined meteg. The immediately preceding word, on the preceding line, has a munah. The accent under the samekh is transcribed here as a meteg reflecting this possibility and marked with a 't' note.
The BHL has meteg under the samekh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reveals that there is a tradition, attested in the Cairo Codex of the Prophets and other sources, of having munaḥ-space on this word (בְּסֵ֣פֶר) instead of meteg-maqaf (בְּסֵֽפֶר־).

change.description: Markings on aleph are unclear. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef qamats munah zayin
change.changeuni: alef qamats munah zayin

notes.note: The ink on this word is flaking off.
The BHL has a qamats then munah under the aleph; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Consider changing the geresh then telisha-gedola on shin to geresh-muqdam then telisha-qetana.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh

notes.note: The geresh-muqdam accent only occurs in the Sifrei Emet; 2 Kings is not in the Sifrei Emet; hence the first accent is a geresh.

The position of the circle and angle of the "tail" determine the difference between a telisha-gedola (prepositive, tail northeast-to-southwest) and a telisha qetana (postpositive, tail northwest-to-southeast). The tail of the telisha is not visible in the image. Since the telisha is on the first consonant of the word, the telisha is prepositive; hence the telisha is a telisha-gedola.
The BHL has a geresh followed by a telisha-gedola above the shin; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Remove geresh from kaf.
change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere qadma lamed sheva kaf geresh vav dagesh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere qadma lamed sheva kaf vav dagesh

notes.note: The BHL has a geresh above the kaf; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace revia on mem with zaqef-qatan.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah revia ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah zaqef-qatan ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats

notes.note: The BHL has a zaqef-qatan above the mem; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace zaqef-qatan above shin with revia. Add note 't'.
change.refuni: mem sheva nun patah shin shin-dot dagesh segol zaqef-qatan he
change.changeuni: mem sheva nun patah shin shin-dot dagesh segol revia he

notes.note: A faint blurr above the left-most dot above the shin may have made the accent a zaqef-qatan. The accent will be transcribed as a revia.
The BHL has a revia above the shin; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace revia above kaf with telisha-gedola.
change.refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq revia yod
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq telisha-gedola yod

notes.note: The BHL has a telisha-gedola above the kaf; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Remove qadma above nun, add pashta to he.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun qamats qadma he
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun qamats he pashta

notes.note: The BHL has a pashta above the he; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace tipeha under the lamed with tevir.
change.refuni: ayin qamats lamed segol tipeha yod he qamats
change.changeuni: ayin qamats lamed segol tevir yod he qamats

notes.note: The BHL has a segol then tevir on the lamed; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Replace merkha under the yod with tipeha.
change.refuni: dalet dagesh qamats yod tsere merkha qof
change.changeuni: dalet dagesh qamats yod tsere tipeha qof

notes.note: The BHL has a tipeha on the yod; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Move munah under resh to under the bet.
change.refuni: shin shin-dot hiriq bet dagesh sheva resh munah vav dagesh
change.changeuni: shin shin-dot hiriq bet dagesh sheva munah resh vav dagesh

notes.note: The BHL has a munah under the resh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

change.description: Remove holam from vav.
change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva resh qamats qof revia vav holam tav
change.changeuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva resh qamats qof revia vav tav

notes.note: The BHL has a holam on the vav; BHL Appendix A shows no holam on the vav.

change.description: Change patah on qof to qamats.
change.refuni: bet dagesh hiriq tav sheva qof patah merkha final-pe
change.changeuni: bet dagesh hiriq tav sheva qof qamats merkha final-pe

notes.note: The dot between the horizontal bar and the merkha under the qof is dark and well-positioned.
BHL has qamats on this qof; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

change.description: Add Unicode paseq at end of word, making a legarmeh after the bet.
change.refuni: vav qamats alef tsere shin shin-dot tsere munah bet
change.changeuni: vav qamats alef tsere shin shin-dot tsere munah bet space paseq

change.description: Change merkha on bet to tipeha.
change.refuni: tet vav holam bet qamats merkha he
change.changeuni: tet vav holam bet qamats tipeha he

change.description: Add dagesh to lamed.
change.refuni: lamed hiriq meteg yod resh hiriq yod het vav holam pashta
change.changeuni: lamed dagesh hiriq meteg yod resh hiriq yod het vav holam pashta

notes.note: Ben Denckla: The BHL agrees that L has this dagesh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

change.description: Remove dagesh from bet and add rafe.
change.refuni: bet dagesh segol final-nun maqaf
change.changeuni: bet rafe segol final-nun maqaf

notes.note: The bet in the LC has a dark rafe and a faint, but well-positioned, potential dagesh. The potential dagesh might also be an erasure or spot on the vellum. By Masoretic practice the rafe indicates the absence of a dagesh. The UXLC conforms to this practice and eliminates the dagesh. Although the UXLC doesn't normally show rafe marks, one is added here as its presence is key to the transcription.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has no dagesh on the bet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
